poem:
Protest Across the Green

Across the green of Menie hills,  
wind spins with purpose, a sea-tuned song—  
while hundred voices rise like turbines,  
a chorus challenging gilded words.  
  
Grateful hearts in far lands hear,  
in their own words, this whispered cheer:  
a breeze of courage from Scottish shores,  
sweeping doubt away.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Starmer defends investment in wind turbines after Trump wrongly claims it is ‘most expensive form of energy’ – UK politics live 5.08pm BST Stop Trump Coalition claims some US citizens 'deeply grateful' to Scottish campaigners for protests against president A hundred or so protesters against Donald Trump have listened to speeches at a demonstration in Balmedie, close to the US president’s Menie golf resort in Aberdeenshire, PA Media reports. PA says: The demonstrators, many carrying". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.

PA says: The demonstrators, many carrying
